segment.source: Applications Results Pane
segment.target: Applications Results Pane

segment.source: Applications Results Pane
segment.target: Applications Results Pane

segment.source: Applications Results Pane
segment.target: Applications Results Pane

segment.source: The Applications Results pane in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console displays a list of the available applications.
segment.target: The Applications Results pane in the Application Virtualization Client Management Console displays a list of the available applications.

segment.source: Users can see a list of applications for which they have been granted access privileges.
segment.target: Users can see a list of applications for which they have been granted access privileges.

segment.source: For more information about the procedures you can perform from this pane, see How to Manage Applications in the Client Management Console.
segment.target: For more information about the procedures you can perform from this pane, see How to Manage Applications in the Client Management Console.

segment.source: Right-click any application to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click any application to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Shortcut
segment.target: New Shortcut

segment.source: This menu item displays the New Shortcut Wizard.
segment.target: This menu item displays the New Shortcut Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of three pages:
segment.target: This wizard consists of three pages:

segment.source: Select an icon, and specify a name for the shortcut:
segment.target: Select an icon, and specify a name for the shortcut:

segment.source: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.
segment.target: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.

segment.source: Browse to and select the desired icon.
segment.target: Browse to and select the desired icon.

segment.source: Shortcut Title—Enter the name you want to give the shortcut.
segment.target: Shortcut Title—Enter the name you want to give the shortcut.

segment.source: This field defaults to the existing name and version of the application.
segment.target: This field defaults to the existing name and version of the application.

segment.source: Determine the location of the published shortcut.
segment.target: Determine the location of the published shortcut.

segment.source: Location of shortcut—Select a location by selecting one of the check boxes.
segment.target: Location of shortcut—Select a location by selecting one of the check boxes.

segment.source: The available locations are Desktop, Quick Launch Toolbar, Send to Menu, Start Menu, and Another location.
segment.target: The available locations are Desktop, Quick Launch Toolbar, Send to Menu, Start Menu, and Another location.

segment.source: Programs in the Start Menu—When you select the Start Menu check box, this field becomes active.
segment.target: Programs in the Start Menu—When you select the Start Menu check box, this field becomes active.

segment.source: Leave this field blank to publish the shortcut directly to the root of the Programs folder, or enter a folder name or hierarchy—for example, "MyComputerOffice Applications."
segment.target: Leave this field blank to publish the shortcut directly to the root of the Programs folder, or enter a folder name or hierarchy—for example, "MyComputerOffice Applications."

segment.source: Shortcuts created this way are available only for the current user.
segment.target: Shortcuts created this way are available only for the current user.

segment.source: Another location and browse button—When you select the Another location check box, this field becomes active.
segment.target: Another location and browse button—When you select the Another location check box, this field becomes active.

segment.source: Enter any valid location on the computer or any available Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path(shared file or directory on a network).
segment.target: Enter any valid location on the computer or any available Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path(shared file or directory on a network).

segment.source: The browse button displays a standard Windows File Open dialog box.
segment.target: The browse button displays a standard Windows File Open dialog box.

segment.source: Enter the desired command-line parameters, and then click Finish to exit the wizard.
segment.target: Enter the desired command-line parameters, and then click Finish to exit the wizard.

segment.source: New Association
segment.target: New Association

segment.source: This menu item displays the New Association Wizard.
segment.target: This menu item displays the New Association Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of two pages:
segment.target: This wizard consists of two pages:

segment.source: Enter a file name extension, and associate the extension with a file type.
segment.target: Enter a file name extension, and associate the extension with a file type.

segment.source: Extension—Enter a file name extension.
segment.target: Extension—Enter a file name extension.

segment.source: This field is blank by default.
segment.target: This field is blank by default.

segment.source: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.
segment.target: Create a new file type with this description—Select this radio button to enter a new file type description in the active field.

segment.source: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.
segment.target: This button is selected by default, and the active field is blank.

segment.source: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.
segment.target: Apply this file type to all users—Select this check box when you want this association to be global for all users.

segment.source: By default, this box is not selected.
segment.target: By default, this box is not selected.

segment.source: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.
segment.target: Link this extension with an existing file type—Select this radio button to associate the extension with an existing file type.

segment.source: Choose a file type from the drop-down list.
segment.target: Choose a file type from the drop-down list.

segment.source: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.
segment.target: When you choose this option, Next is changed to Finish.

segment.source: Select the application that will open files with the specified extension:
segment.target: Select the application that will open files with the specified extension:

segment.source: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.
segment.target: Open files with the selected application—Select this radio button to open the file with an existing application.

segment.source: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.
segment.target: Choose an application from the drop-down list of available applications.

segment.source: Open file with the association described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.
segment.target: Open file with the association described in this OSD file—Select this radio button to specify an Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file that determines the application used to open the file.

segment.source: Use the browse button to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.
segment.target: Use the browse button to select an existing location, or enter a path or HTTP-formatted URL in this field.

segment.source: Repair
segment.target: Repair

segment.source: Resets the application default settings and eliminates all user-defined settings for the selected application.
segment.target: Resets the application default settings and eliminates all user-defined settings for the selected application.

segment.source: Load or Unload
segment.target: Load or Unload

segment.source: Loads or unloads the selected application into the cache.
segment.target: Loads or unloads the selected application into the cache.

segment.source: This command is not available if 100 percent of the application is in the cache.
segment.target: This command is not available if 100 percent of the application is in the cache.

segment.source: Clear
segment.target: Clear

segment.source: Removes the user's settings, shortcuts, and file type associations for the selected application.
segment.target: Removes the user's settings, shortcuts, and file type associations for the selected application.

segment.source: This item is not available if a user is running any application from a suite of applications.
segment.target: This item is not available if a user is running any application from a suite of applications.

segment.source: Displays a confirmation prompt.
segment.target: Displays a confirmation prompt.

segment.source: Lock or Unlock
segment.target: Lock or Unlock

segment.source: Locks or unlocks an application in the cache.
segment.target: Locks or unlocks an application in the cache.

segment.source: When an application is locked, it cannot be deleted or overwritten.
segment.target: When an application is locked, it cannot be deleted or overwritten.

segment.source: Import
segment.target: Import

segment.source: Imports an application into the cache directly from this command in the Applications node.
segment.target: Imports an application into the cache directly from this command in the Applications node.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Deletes an application from the Results pane and from the computer, and clears the application from cache.
segment.target: Deletes an application from the Results pane and from the computer, and clears the application from cache.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Refreshes the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: Refreshes the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: Properties
segment.target: Properties

segment.source: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected application.
segment.target: Displays the Properties dialog box for the selected application.

segment.source: This dialog box has two tabs:
segment.target: This dialog box has two tabs:

segment.source: The General tab displays the application icon and name, the location from where the application was streamed, and the path to the local OSD file.
segment.target: The General tab displays the application icon and name, the location from where the application was streamed, and the path to the local OSD file.

segment.source: From this tab, you can change the icon for the application or you can clear the settings (which removes the shortcuts and the file type associations).
segment.target: From this tab, you can change the icon for the application or you can clear the settings (which removes the shortcuts and the file type associations).

segment.source: The Package tab displays information about the application package, and you can Lock, Unlock, Load, Unload, and Import applications.
segment.target: The Package tab displays information about the application package, and you can Lock, Unlock, Load, Unload, and Import applications.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the Client Management Console help system.
segment.target: Displays the Client Management Console help system.

segment.source: Displaying General Options for the Results pane
segment.target: Displaying General Options for the Results pane

segment.source: Right-click anywhere in the Results pane to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.
segment.target: Right-click anywhere in the Results pane to display a pop-up menu that contains the following elements.

segment.source: New Application
segment.target: New Application

segment.source: This menu item displays the New Application Wizard.
segment.target: This menu item displays the New Application Wizard.

segment.source: This wizard consists of one page where you can select an icon for the application and browse to or enter a URL or a path to the OSD file:
segment.target: This wizard consists of one page where you can select an icon for the application and browse to or enter a URL or a path to the OSD file:

segment.source: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.
segment.target: Change Icon—Displays a standard Windows icon browser.

segment.source: Browse to and select the desired icon.
segment.target: Browse to and select the desired icon.

segment.source: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full UNC path, or an HTTP URL.
segment.target: OSD File Path or URL—Enter a local absolute path, a full UNC path, or an HTTP URL.

segment.source: ... (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.
segment.target: ... (OSD browse button)—Displays the standard Windows Open File dialog box.

segment.source: Browse to find the desired file.
segment.target: Browse to find the desired file.

segment.source: Refresh
segment.target: Refresh

segment.source: Refreshes the Results pane.
segment.target: Refreshes the Results pane.

segment.source: Export List
segment.target: Export List

segment.source: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.
segment.target: You can use this menu item to create a tab-delimited text file that contains the contents of the Results pane.

segment.source: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.
segment.target: This item displays a standard File Save dialog box where you specify the location for the text file you are creating.

segment.source: View
segment.target: View

segment.source: This pop-up list of menu items lets you change the appearance and content of the Results pane.
segment.target: This pop-up list of menu items lets you change the appearance and content of the Results pane.

segment.source: Arrange/Line Up Icons
segment.target: Arrange/Line Up Icons

segment.source: These menu items can be used to change how the icons are displayed in the Results pane.
segment.target: These menu items can be used to change how the icons are displayed in the Results pane.

segment.source: Help
segment.target: Help

segment.source: Displays the help system for the management console.
segment.target: Displays the help system for the management console.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Applications Node

segment.source: Applications Results Pane Columns
segment.target: Applications Results Pane Columns

segment.target: Application Virtualization Client Management Console Reference

segment.target: How to Manage Applications in the Client Management Console
